info.title: DDEI API Endpoints
info.description: HTTP API Endpoints for interaction with CMS.

post.description:
Adds an action plan for DCF pre-charge, DCF post charge, TWIF pre-charge and TWIF post charge.
There is a difference in the request body for DCF and TWIF. See the request description for more information.
For both a DCF or TWIF pre-charge case, a PCD review needs to be started before actions can be added.
For both DCF and TWIF pre-charge, action plans are saved as draft and sent with the review.
For both DCF and TWIF post charge, actions plans are sent when created.
Use the endpoint "/cases/{caseId}/action-plan/steps" to determine the "code" field for action plan steps. The codes are relatively static and can be cached.

parameters.name: caseId
parameters.description: The Id of the case to add a new action plan.

requestBody.description:
DCF request requirements for both pre-charge and post charge:
  • The action "date" field is mandatory and can be today or a future date.
  • The "status" field must be supplied and should be "Not Sent" when adding a new action or updating a draft one.
  • At least one action plan step needs to be defined with both a "code" and "text" field. Valid codes can be obtained by calling the endpoint "/cases/{caseId}/action-plan/steps". The "text" field has a character length limitation of 49,900.
  • The "chaserTaskDate" field is not relevant to DCF.
  • The "defendantId" field can be a valid defendant ID on the case.
DCF request requirements pre-charge:
  • The "dG6Justification" field must be supplied with any of the following values:
    • PreCharge
    • Triage
DCF request requirements post-charge:
  • The "dG6Justification" field must be supplied with any of the following values:
    • CaseManagement
    • Evidential
    • Progression
    • Sentence
TWIF request requirements for both pre-charge and post charge:
  • The action "date" field is mandatory and can be today or a future date.
  • The "chaserTaskDate" field is optional. If specified, can be today or a future date and will result in a chaser task being created.
  • At least one action plan step needs to be defined with both a "code" and "text" field. Valid codes can be obtained by calling the endpoint "/cases/{caseId}/action-plan/steps".
  • The "dG6Justification" field is not relevant to TWIF.
  • The "defendantId" field can be a valid defendant ID on the case. Set this value to 0 (zero) if the action relates to all defendants.
  • The "allDefendants" boolean field should be true if defendant ID is zero and false if defendant ID is for a defendant on the case.
TWIF request requirements pre-charge:
  • The "type" field must be supplied with any of the following values:
    • ActionPlan
    • PreChargeSplit
    For "ActionPlan", the action plan step "text" field can be up to 50,000 characters long.
    For "PreChargeSplit", the action plan step "text" field can be up to 8,000 characters long.
  • The field "actionPointText" is not relevant.
TWIF request requirements post charge:
  • The "type" field must be supplied with any of the following values:
    • ModifyFileBuild
    • StopFileBuild
    For "ModifyFileBuild", the action plan step "text" field can be up to 50,000 characters long.
    For "StopFileBuild", the action plan step "text" field can be up to 8,000 characters long.
  • The field "actionPointText" must be specified.

post.description:
Adds an action plan for DCF disclosure. The following action plans can be created:
  • inadequate-description: request the investigating agency to provide an improved description for the disclosure material.
  • request-document: request the investigating agency to provide missing or improved content for the disclosure material.
  • request-status-change: request the investigating agency to change the status of content for the disclosure material.

parameters.name: caseId
parameters.description: The ID of the case to add a new disclosure action plan to.

parameters.name: materialId
parameters.description: The ID of the disclosure material that this action plan relates to.

parameters.name: actionPlanType
parameters.description: The type of action plan to create. Supported plan types are: 'inadequate-description' , 'request-document' and 'request-status-change'.

400.description:
If the case ID provided is zero.
If the action plan type provided is not one of the supported types. Supported plan types are: 'inadequate-description' , 'request-document and 'request-status-change''.

401.description: The user calling the function is not authenticated.

parameters.name: caseId
parameters.description: The Id of the case to delete hearings for.

requestBody.description:
The body of the request must contain the hearing ID(s) to delete.
A reason for the deletion must also be provided.
The body must be a JSON object with the following properties:
  • hearingIdentifiers: An array of integers of hearing ID(s) to delete.
  • reasonForDelete: The reason for deleting the hearings. Please note, commas are not allowed in the reason for deletion text and will result in a bad request.

400.description:
If the case ID provided is less than or equal to zero.
If the delete reason is not provided.
If the delete reason contains commas.
If the delete reason is longer than 500 characters.
If the case hearing identifiers are not provided.
If the case hearing identifiers are not found.

401.description: The user calling the function is not authenticated.

get.description: Gets all of the hearings for a case, unless a hearing date filter is requested.

parameters.name: caseId
parameters.description: The Id of the case to get hearings for.

parameters.name: hearingDate
parameters.description:
Optionally apply this filter in the format 'yyyy-mm-dd' to get only the hearings from this date. For example:
/cases/123/hearings?hearingDate=2024-12-20

400.description:
If the case ID provided is less than or equal to zero.
If the hearing date filter is provided but is not a valid date in the format 'yyyy-mm-dd'.

401.description: The user calling the function is not authenticated.

401.description: Payload of String

post.description:
Generates one of the following case documents: 'ActionPlan', 'ConfidentialInformation', 'FactualSummary', 'Review' or 'UnusedSchedule'.
Before trying to generate an 'UnusedSchedule', check the status using the "cases/caseId/generated-documents/for-case/unused-schedule/status" endpoint.

parameters.name: caseId
parameters.description: The ID of the case to generate documents for.

parameters.name: documentType
parameters.description: The document type to generate: 'ActionPlan', 'ConfidentialInformation', 'FactualSummary', 'Review' or 'UnusedSchedule'.

400.description: If the case ID provided is less than or equal to zero.

401.description: The user calling the function is not authenticated.

get.description:
NOTE: this endpoint will be deprecated in favour of cases/{caseId}/generated-documents/for-case/unused-schedules.
This endpoint is needed for backwards compatability with the API on CIN2.

Gets the unused schedule generated for the case. Will return null if one does not exist.

parameters.name: caseId
parameters.description: The ID of the case to get the generated unused schedule for.

200.description:
Returns information about the generated unused schedule, or null if one does not exist.
The document type is always 'UnusedSchedule'.

400.description: If the case ID provided is less than or equal to zero.

401.description: The user calling the function is not authenticated.

get.description:
Gets the unused schedules generated for the case. Can return up to 3 different types of documents across the legacy document types MG6C/D/E.

  1. Schedule of non sensitive unused material [for the MG6C] - document type ScheduleOfNonSensitiveUnusedMaterial
  2. Schedule of sensitive unused material [for the MG6D] - document type ScheduleOfSensitiveUnusedMaterial
  3. Disclosure Officer's report [for the MG6E] - document type DisclosureOfficersReport

If any items are listed in the unused non-sensitive material section they will be used to build an MG6C.
If any items are listed in the unused sensitive material section they will be used to build an MG6D.
If any items are listed in either unused material section marked with a CPS disclosure status of Unused - Disclosable or Unused - Disclosable by Inspection section they will be used to build an MG6E.

Note : discarded material is also to be logically excluded from any schedule. Any material marked as Not Relevant by the CPS is always excluded from any schedule.

parameters.name: caseId
parameters.description: The ID of the case to get the generated unused schedules for.

200.description:
Returns information about the generated unused schedules, or an empty list if none exist.

Possible document types:

  1. Schedule of non sensitive unused material - ScheduleOfNonSensitiveUnusedMaterial
  2. Schedule of sensitive unused material - ScheduleOfSensitiveUnusedMaterial
  3. Disclosure Officer's report - DisclosureOfficersReport

400.description: If the case ID provided is less than or equal to zero.

401.description: The user calling the function is not authenticated.

get.description:
Gets the unused schedule generation status for a DCF case. The schedule can be generated if "scheduleGenerationAllowed" is true.
For DCF cases, if "scheduleGenerationAllowed" is false, "generationIssues" will contain the reason(s) why the schedule cannot be generated.
For TWIF cases, "scheduleGenerationAllowed" is always false.

parameters.name: caseId
parameters.description: The ID of the case to get the unused schedule generation status for.

200.description:
Returns information about the unused schedule generation status for a DCF case. If "scheduleGenerationAllowed" is true, the schedule can be generated.
If "scheduleGenerationAllowed" is false, the "generationIssues" array can have a few of the following entries Code: code description:
  • Manifest:
    An LM05 or LM06 item listed in the CJ05 manifest is missing.
  • DisclosureCertification:
    There is no disclosure certification, or the most recent certification received is marked as invalid.
  • EvidentialStatusMismatch:
    There is a disclosure status mismatch with the mismatched material deemed to be evidence.
  • UnusedStatusMismatch:
    There is a disclosure status mismatch with the mismatched material deemed to be unused.
  • EvidentialAndUnusedStatusMismatch:
    There is a disclosure status mismatch with the mismatched material deemed to be both evidence and unused.
  • EvidentialSensitivityStatusMismatch:
    There is a sensitivity status mismatch with the mismatched material deemed to be evidence.
  • UnusedSensitivityStatusMismatch:
    There is a sensitivity status mismatch with the mismatched material deemed to be unused.
  • EvidentialAndUnusedSensitivityStatusMismatch:
    There is a sensitivity status mismatch with the mismatched material deemed to be both evidence and unused.
  • OpenClarifySensitivityRationaleActionExists:
    There is an open 'Clarify Sensitivity Rationale' action for the mismatched material.

400.description: If the case ID provided is less than or equal to zero.

401.description: The user calling the function is not authenticated.

404.description: The case identified by 'caseId' could not be found.

400.description: If the case ID provided is less than or equal to zero.

401.description: The user calling the function is not authenticated.

post.description: Merges two or more cases.

parameters.name: caseId
parameters.description: The ID of the case that has the primary URN for the merge.

requestBody.description:
The body of the request must contain the other case ID(s) to merge.
The body must be a JSON object with the following properties:
  • otherCases: An array of integers of the other case ID(s) to merge.
  • prosecutorId: TWIF only, optionally provide the 64 bit integer resource ID of the prosecutor to allocate to the case. This value is mandatory if a paralegal officer resource ID is provided.
  • paralegalId: TWIF only, optionally provide the 64 bit integer resource ID of the paralegal officer to allocate to the case.

404.description: The case identified by 'caseId' could not be found.

400.description:
If a case ID provided is less than or equal to zero.
If zero other case ID(s) are provided.
If one or more other case ID(s) do not exist.
If any of the cases are in different units.
If any of the cases are finalised.
If there is a mix of DCF and TWIF cases.
For TWIF only cases:
  • If any of the cases are locked.
  • If a paralegal ID is provided without a prosecutor ID.
  • If the prosecutor ID is not in the list of valid prosecutors.
  • If the paralegal ID is not in the list of valid paralegals.
For DCF only cases:
  • If more than one of the cases has an active review.
  • If any of the cases have different police consortium identifiers.

401.description: The user calling the function is not authenticated.

202.description:
The merge request has been accepted and will continue to be processed asynchronously.
Use the list cases endpoint 'GET urns/{urn}/cases' to identify when the merged case has been created.

get.description: Gets information on a case prior to a split.

parameters.name: caseId
parameters.description: The ID of the case that requires splitting.

200.description: Gets the information on a case prior to splitting.

400.description: If the case ID provided is less than or equal to zero.

401.description: The user calling the function is not authenticated.

post.description:
For a post charge case: requests CMS to asynchronously split the case into two or more cases. The request is queued and can take several minutes to complete.
For a pre charge case: requests CMS to asynchronously create an action plan and send it to the police requesting them to split the case.
NOTE: TWIF cases are not supported by this function.

parameters.name: caseId
parameters.description: The ID of the case to split.

requestBody.description:
The body of the request must contain the split type; either 'PostCharge' or 'PreCharge'.
Case numbers need to be numbered from 1 and be sequential; for example, 1 2 3.
The body must be a JSON object with the following properties:
  • splitType: The mandatory type of split to perform. This must be either 'PostCharge' or 'PreCharge'.
  • details: An array of objects containing the details of the cases to be split. Each object must contain the following properties:
    • suspectId: The mandatory ID of the suspect to split.
    • suspectAssignedCaseNumber: only required for pre charge splits and for suspects that only have proposed charges.
    • charges: An array of objects containing the details of the charges to be split.
      Note: This property is mandatory for post charge splits. For pre charge splits, this property is only mandatory if the suspect has charges pending add.
      When required, each object must contain the following properties:
      • chargeId: The ID of the charge to be split.
      • chargeAssignedCaseNumber: The assigned case number for the charge.

404.description: The case identified by 'caseId' could not be found.

400.description:
If a case ID provided is less than or equal to zero.
If one or more suspect ID(s) do not exist.
If any suspect ID(s) are missing.
If one or more charge ID(s) do not exist.
If any charge ID(s) are missing.
If the assigned case number(s) are not sequential and do not start from 1.
If there are less than two assigned case numbers.

401.description: The user calling the function is not authenticated.

202.description:
Post charge case: the split request has been accepted and will continue to be processed asynchronously.
Pre charge case: an action plan will be created and sent to the police requesting a case split.

post.description: Completes the 'Check Merged Case' task.

parameters.name: caseId
parameters.description: The ID of the recently merged case.

requestBody.description:
The body of the request contains the task ID(s) to delete.
The body must be a JSON object with the following properties:
  • tasksToDelete: An array of integers of the task ID(s) used to identify the tasks to delete. Note: this list can be empty if all tasks are to be kept on the merged case.
  • upgradeFileFlag: An optional flag that if checked, will upgrade the file flag.
  • cancelReplyChaseTask: An optional flag that if checked, will cancel the reply chase task.

400.description: If a case ID provided is less than or equal to zero.

401.description: The user calling the function is not authenticated.

204.description:
Tasks will get deleted from the merged case if their IDs are provided in the request.
The 'Check Merged Case' task will be completed.

post.description: Adds a charge to a defendant in a case and optionally associates a victim with the charge.

parameters.name: caseId
parameters.description: The ID of the case of the defendant for which to add a charge.

parameters.name: defendantId
parameters.description: The ID of the defendant for which to add a charge.

requestBody.description:
The body of the request contains information about the charge to be added.
The body must be a JSON object with the following properties:
  • code: The code of the charge to be added; for example, "CM85002".
  • chargeParticulars: The particulars of the charge.
  • fromDate: The date from which the charge is effective; for example, "2025-01-01".
  • toDate: The date until which the charge is effective; for example, "2025-01-02". This date is optional.
  • category: The category of the charge; for example, "PendingCharge" or "Charge".
  • victimId: The optional victim ID of the victim associated with the charge.

404.description:
The case identified by 'caseId' could not be found.
The defendant identified by 'defendantId' could not be found in the case.

400.description:
If the case ID or defendant ID is zero.
If the charge code is not provided.
If the charge fromDate is not provided or is in the future.
if the charge toDate is provided but is before the fromDate.
If a victimId is provided but the victim does not exist in the case.

401.description: The user calling the function is not authenticated.

204.description: A charge will be added to the defendant in the case.

post.description: Completes the 'Consider Reactivation Request' task.

parameters.name: caseId
parameters.description: The ID of the case to complete the task for.

requestBody.description:
The body of the request contains information on whether to accept or reject the case reactivation request.
The body must be a JSON object with the following properties:
  • acceptReactivationRequest: a boolean indicating whether to accept the reactivation request; true if the request is to be accepted, false if it is to be rejected.
  • rejectionReason: the reason for rejecting the reactivation request, if applicable. This field is mandatory if acceptReactivationRequest is false.

400.description:
If the case ID provided is less than or equal to zero.
If the request was rejected but no reason was provided.
If the 'Consider Reactivation Request' task does not exist for the case.

401.description: The user calling the function is not authenticated.

204.description: The 'Consider Reactivation Request' task will be completed.

get.description: Get witnesses for a given case.

parameters.name: caseId
parameters.description: The Id of the case to get witnesses for.

parameters.name: returnVictimsOnly
parameters.description: Optional: whether to return only witnesses classed as victims. The default value is false.

parameters.name: witnessFilter
parameters.description: Optional: a filter consisting of any combination of the following characters 'TLCXGIPHFSV' where Intimidated = T, Vulnerable = L, Child = C, Expert = X, GreatestNeed = G, Interpreter = I, Police = P, Prisoner = H, Professional = F, SpecialNeeds = S, Victim = V. The default value is empty, returning all witnesses and pure victims.

caseRecieved.description: Date and Time defined in ISO 8601 format yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ

partyId.description: PartyId of user which the Early Advice triage task needs to be assigned

partyDescription.description: Party Description of user which the Early Advice triage task needs to be assigned

username.description: User's CMS username used for authentication.

password.description: User's CMS password used for authentication.

createCheckCommunicationTask.description: If a check communication task should be created.

markCommunicationAsRead.description: Should communication be marked as read.

ChaserDateForm.description: Date for which to create a reminder task after task completion.

Comments.description: Comments associated to the task completion.

SuppressTaskForFutureHearings.description: Boolean determining whther to suppress creating tasks of this types for future hearings after task completion.

UppgradeFileComplete.description: Boolean determining whther to upgrade the file associated with the task after task completion.

defendantIds.description: List of defendant Ids for which to create direction

directionTypeCode.description: List of direction type codes for each direction

directionTexts.description: List of direction texts for each direction

dueDates.description: List of due dates for each direction. Dates must be in dd/MM/yyy format.

assignees.description: List of assignees for each direction

nextHearingIds.description: List of hearing id for each defendant

manualClosureOnlyFlags.description: List of manual closure flags for each direction

unit.description: The Unit in which the task is found.

unitGroup.description: The Unit Group in which the task is found.

taskFor.description: The owner of the task to be deleted.

taskType.description: The type of the task to be deleted.

severity.description: The severity of the task to be deleted.

hearingDate.description: The type of the task to be deleted.

PaceClock.description: Pace Clock with the date and time.

isAssigned.description: Boolean determining whether the monitoring code is enabled.

decision.description: "Accepted" or "Rejected" or "NFS Compliant" or "NFS Non-Compliant" or "Priority/Red Rejection"

PartyId.description: The Id of tha new party to be assigned to the task.

TaskIds.description: The Ids of the tasks whose party is to be reassigned.

rejectionReasons.description: Rejection Reasons as defined by the rejectionReasons API

actionPlanDue.description: Required for TWIF case only. Date and Time defined in ISO 8601 format yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ

chaseTaskDue.description: Required for TWIF case only. Date and Time defined in ISO 8601 format yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ

IsUrgent.description: A flag indicating whether to update a task to be urgent or not.

Comment.description: A comment for the task urgency change.

cms_auth_values.description: The CMS Auth Values. This can be retrieved via the Authenticate API Endpoint.
